resources.string: \ Sudoku is a logic-based number placement puzzle. Starting with a partially completed 9x9 grid, the objective is to fill the grid so that each row, each column, and each of the 3x3 boxes (also called blocks) contains the digits 1 to 9 exactly once.

• EditText usage: http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/ui/controls.html 


• Usage of EditText.onTextChangedListener function: http://www.bipinrupadiya.com/2012/09/addtextchangedlistener-in-android.html 


• Ringtone usage for producing the beep sound during search: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4441334/how-to-play-an-android-notification-sound/9622040#9622040 


• How to add text in billet points in TextView: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3429546/android-how-to-add-bullet-symbol-in-textview 


• Some links that I referenced regarding the quickest way to lookup words: 
 	 1) http://stackoverflow.com/questions/15663241/search-word-in-word-list-text-file-in-android 
 	 2) https://android.googlesource.com/platform/development/+/donut-release2%5E/samples/ SearchableDictionary/src/com/example/android/searchabledict/Dictionary.java 


• Source of beep mp3: http://soundbible.com/1251-Beep.html 


• Idea of splitting the file was discussed in class. Initially my approach was to split the file to 26 parts. Later upon discussions in class with Prof. Intille, splitting the wordlist.txt to 519 files made more sense
